availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Paschal Meador (Meade County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier - 2nd Sgt. 58th Va. Inf.)

body.p: Meade County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Quintina Wright Meador in Franklin County, Virginia, on March 15, 1841. Father of John Meador, Nancy Meador, Elizabeth Meador, Susan Meador, John Meador, Abel Meador, Sarah Meador, and Alfred Meador. Farmer in Meade County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Meade County in 1850. Farmer in Meade County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Meade County in 1860. Served in the 58th Virginia Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a second sergeant from July 23, 1861.
